intro: Parnassia cacuminum var. longistipitata, commonly known as the long-stemmed parnassia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers with a distinctive yellowish-green throat. The plant features a slender, often hairy stem that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are palmately divided, typically with five to seven lobes, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Parnassia cacuminum var. longistipitata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
